data.event: The area that is now Marion was used in the 1860s by rancher Samuel P. Hoyt, whose 600â€“700 head of cattle grazed over most of Marion's land.

event.title: organized the first ward in the area in 1909

data.event: The name Marion has been credited to two different sources: Francis Marion Lyman, who, as President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, organized the first ward in the area in 1909, and Marion Myrick Sorensen, who settled here with her first husband in 1882.

event.title: settled here with her first husband in 1882

data.event: The name Marion has been credited to two different sources: Francis Marion Lyman, who, as President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, organized the first ward in the area in 1909, and Marion Myrick Sorensen, who settled here with her first husband in 1882.

event.title: appeared under that name in the 1900

data.event: The Marion precinct first appeared under that name in the 1900 census.
